Election and cyber security experts agree that my #PAVEAct is the legislation we need to secure American elections. https://www.wyden.senate.gov/news/press-releases/wyden-and-bicameral-coalition-introduce-bill-to-require-states-to-secure-elections- …

Thanks to the support @SenBlumenthal @SenMarkey @SenJeffMerkley @SenDuckworth @SenBrianSchatz @SenWarren @SenBooker @gillibrandny @SenatorBaldwin @SenSanders @SenatorCantwell @SenKamalaHarris, @repblumenauer we won't stop fighting until the #PAVEAct becomes the law of the land.

For too long, the American people have lived in fear that their votes could be lost or tampered with. The failure of lawmakers to tackle this problem head on is eroding American democracy. The time to act is now, and my #PAVEAct is the way to do it.

Today I’m introducing the #PAVEAct. My legislation will take three concrete steps to secure our elections:
 
📬 Require hand-marked #PaperBallots
🚨 Implement risk-limiting audits
🖥 For the first time ever, set cyber security standards for federal elections
In 2016, Russia ran a campaign to interfere in our elections and undermine the will of the American people. And we KNOW they are going to do it again, unless lawmakers act. Now. #PAVEAct
It’s time to secure America’s elections from hackers and foreign interference. Today I’m introducing my bill to do it. #PAVEAct pic.twitter.com/zRgTjYXWW4

More people need to be talking about this. For Trump and Republicans in Congress, the biggest goal has been to roll back the expansion of civil rights over the last 100 years, and they’re succeeding.

The fight over Kavanaugh and Gorsuch wasn’t a matter of Democrats vs. Republicans. The reason we fought so hard was because these court appointments will have the most lasting impact, especially when it comes to women’s rights.
